docs.snippet: Speakers at the teenager’s funeral service, addressing an overflowing crowd, exhorted mourners to work for justice, not just for Mr. Brown, but for others....
docs.lead_paragraph: Speakers at the teenager’s funeral service, addressing an overflowing crowd, exhorted mourners to work for justice, not just for Mr. Brown, but for others.
docs.abstract: Funeral for Michael Brown in St Louis, Mo, is infused with Scripture and song, and is a mix of intimate reflections and national policy plans; people from all walks of life attend, including celebrities, representatives from the White House, members of Congress, civil rights leaders and hundreds of residents; leaders urge those gathered to memorialize his life by carrying forward a unified effort to seek change across country.

headline.main: Amid Mourning for Michael Brown, Call for Change

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Motoko Rich and Richard Pérez-Peña from New York; Mosi Secret and John Eligon from St. Louis; and Frances Robles from Ferguson, Mo.
